intro: Swertia angustifolia var. wallichiana, commonly known as the narrow-leaf swertia, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayan regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high elevations. Its medicinal properties have been traditionally used in herbal remedies for digestive and respiratory ailments.
